subtitle: Trouble sleeping
title: Pregnant Mom
content:
I am in my 9th month of pregnancy. I can feel my baby moving 4 to 5 times a day. It must be a cherishable moment for a pregnant mother to nurture positive thoughts.But for me things are quiet different. My back hurts all the time. Lately, I can’t sleep at all, as I cannot turn while lying on the bed. Now I feel dizzy all the time. I try to think positive all the time and try to maintain a healthy routine. But nothing seems to help.
My doctor said that the baby’s head is upwards. For that I’ve been told do another ultrasonography. Can that hurt my baby?

**APONJON HELP: You can use warm compression and take a paracetamol tablet after meal if your back hurts a lot. Avoid lifting heavy weight. Try reading some books at bedtime – this will help you sleep.
Ultrasonography is absolutely safe – it will not hurt your baby.**
